[[Image:Patrick Hunt 25 January 1973.png|thumb]] On [[25 January]] [[1973]], [[J.R.R. Tolkien]] wrote '''[[Letters not published in The Letters of J.R.R. Tolkien|a letter]] to Patrick Hunt'''.{{webcite|author=|articleurl=http://www.tolkienlibrary.com/dmiller/CLP0159.htm|articlename=#CLP0159 - Original photograph of J.R.R. Tolkien signed and dedicated to Patrick Hunt, plus signed letter|dated=|website=TL|accessed=19 March 2012}} *'''Subject:''' Personal greetings. *'''Comments:''' Mr. Hunt, who had written to Tolkien, was at this time in prison. The daughter of Mr. Hunt recalls that this letter and photograph were Mr. Hunt's prized possessions and that he later was to read ''[[The Hobbit]]'' and ''[[The Lord of the Rings]]'' to his daughter (and her siblings). *'''Publication:''' None. *'''Description:''' A handwritten letter (one page) and signed photograph. ==Transcription== {{blockquote| Jan. 25th 1973 Dear Mr Hunt,
Thank you very much for your kind letter; it is most encouraging (to an author) to learn that his books have given pleasure and encouragement.
I have had v. dark days of my own in my time, and I do hope that yours will soon now be over.
With v. best wishes
Yours sincerely
JRR Tolkien.}} {{References}} [[Category:Letters|Hunt, Patrick]]
